subject: Music
title: Dolly Parton: Country's Greatest Songwriter
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dolly Parton: Country's Greatest Songwriter.

hook.text: Dolly Parton wrote Jolene and I Will Always Love You on the same day â€” both became timeless.

buildup.text: Growing up dirt poor in the Smoky Mountains, she was one of 12 children in a one-room cabin.

discovery.text: She's written over 3,000 songs â€” more than almost any songwriter in any genre.

twist.text: She turned down Elvis when he demanded half the publishing rights to I Will Always Love You.

climax.text: Her Imagination Library has given over 200 million free books to children worldwide.

punchline.text: She wrote 3,000 songs and gave 200 million books. Generosity is her real art.

quiz.question: Why did Dolly Parton turn down Elvis's request to record her song?
options: He demanded half the publishing rights
He wanted to change the lyrics
